p: Linseed oil supplementation significantly decreased the concentration of C16:1 (p = 0.024), C17:1 (p<0.001), C18:1 cis-9 (p = 0.006) and total MUFA (p = 0.011) in MLD compared to rapeseed oil and control groups ( Table 5). The addition of rapeseed oil to the diets significantly decreased C15:1 concentration (p = 0.006) in MLD in comparison to control and linseed oil rations. Moreover, the addition of linseed oil to lamb diets significantly increased C24:1 contents (p = 0.003) in MS than in control and did not influence other MUFA (p>0.100) ( Table 6).
